question: 選手
sourceMnemonic: Remember how <ja>手</ja> can mean "doer" in some words? Well this is one of them. In sports, you must <kanji>choose</kanji> the best <kanji>doer</kanji> for your team. In the world of sports, these "chosen doers" are the  <vocabulary>pro athlete</vocabulary>s and  <vocabulary>sports player </vocabulary>s.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>選</ja> is what you'd expect. <ja>手</ja> is the on'yomi reading as it is every once in a while, especially when it has to do with representing a person, so you'll have to remember that. I think you've seen <ja>手</ja> using this reading enough to be able to remember it, though.
